channel.description: Recent content in Homepage on ✟ Christian Writings ✟

item.title: 1 Chronicles 1
item.description: v1 Adam, Seth, Enosh, v2 Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared, v3 Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,

item.title: 1 Chronicles 2
item.description: v1 These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,

item.title: 1 Chronicles 3
item.description: v1 Now these were the sons of David, who were born to him in Hebron: the firstborn, Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second, Daniel, of Abigail the Carmelitess;

item.title: 1 Chronicles 4
item.description: v1 The sons of Judah: Perez, Hezron, Carmi, Hur, and Shobal.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 5
item.description: v1 The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn; but, because he defiled his father’s couch, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph the son of Israel; and the genealogy is not to be listed according to the birthright.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 6
item.description: v1 The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari. v2 The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 7
item.description: v1 Of the sons of Issachar: Tola, and Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 8
item.description: v1 Benjamin became the father of Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third,

item.title: 1 Chronicles 9
item.description: v1 So all Israel were listed by genealogies; and behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel.

item.title: 1 Kings 1
item.description: v1 Now king David was old and advanced in years; and they covered him with clothes, but he couldn’t keep warm.

item.title: 1 Kings 2
item.description: v1 Now the days of David came near that he should die; and he commanded Solomon his son, saying,

item.title: 1 Kings 3
item.description: v1 Solomon made an alliance with Pharaoh king of Egypt, and took Pharaoh’s daughter, and brought her into David’s city, until he had finished building his own house, Yahweh’s house, and the wall around Jerusalem.

item.title: 1 Kings 4
item.description: v1 King Solomon was king over all Israel. v2 These were the princes whom he had: Azariah the son of Zadok, the priest;

item.title: 1 Kings 5
item.description: v1 Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants to Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the place of his father, and Hiram had always loved David.

item.title: 1 Kings 6
item.description: v1 In the four hundred and eightieth year after the children of Israel had come out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon’s reign over Israel, in the month Ziv, which is the second month, he began to build Yahweh’s house.

item.title: 1 Kings 7
item.description: v1 Solomon was building his own house thirteen years, and he finished all his house.

item.title: 1 Kings 8
item.description: v1 Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, with all the heads of the tribes, the princes of the fathers’ households of the children of Israel, to king Solomon in Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of Yahweh’s covenant out of David’s city, which is Zion.

item.title: 1 Kings 9
item.description: v1 When Solomon had finished the building of Yahweh’s house, the king’s house, and all Solomon’s desire which he was pleased to do,

item.title: 1 Samuel 1
item.description: v1 Now there was a certain man of Ramathaim Zophim, of the hill country of Ephraim, and his name was Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite.

item.title: 1 Samuel 2
item.description: v1 Hannah prayed, and said: “My heart exults in Yahweh! My horn is exalted in Yahweh.

item.title: 1 Samuel 3
item.description: v1 The child Samuel ministered to Yahweh before Eli. Yahweh’s word was rare in those days.

item.title: 1 Samuel 4
item.description: v1 Now Israel went out against the Philistines to battle, and encamped beside Ebenezer; and the Philistines encamped in Aphek.

item.title: 1 Samuel 5
item.description: v1 Now the Philistines had taken God’s ark, and they brought it from Ebenezer to Ashdod.

item.title: 1 Samuel 6
item.description: v1 Yahweh’s ark was in the country of the Philistines seven months.

item.title: 1 Samuel 7
item.description: v1 The men of Kiriath Jearim came and took Yahweh’s ark, and brought it into Abinadab’s house on the hill, and consecrated Eleazar his son to keep Yahweh’s ark.

item.title: 1 Samuel 8
item.description: v1 When Samuel was old, he made his sons judges over Israel.

item.title: 1 Samuel 9
item.description: v1 Now there was a man of Benjamin, whose name was Kish the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Becorath, the son of Aphiah, the son of a Benjamite, a mighty man of valor.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 1
item.description: v1 Solomon the son of David was firmly established in his kingdom, and Yahweh his God was with him, and made him exceedingly great.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 2
item.description: v1 Now Solomon decided to build a house for Yahweh’s name, and a house for his kingdom.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 3
item.description: v1 Then Solomon began to build Yahweh’s house at Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where Yahweh appeared to David his father, which he prepared in the place that David had appointed, on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 4
item.description: v1 Then he made an altar of bronze, twenty cubits long, twenty cubits wide, and ten cubits high.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 5
item.description: v1 Thus all the work that Solomon did for Yahweh’s house was finished.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 6
item.description: v1 Then Solomon said, “Yahweh has said that he would dwell in the thick darkness.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 7
item.description: v1 Now when Solomon had finished praying, fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices; and Yahweh’s glory filled the house.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 8
item.description: v1 At the end of twenty years, in which Solomon had built Yahweh’s house and his own house,

item.title: 2 Chronicles 9
item.description: v1 When the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, she came to test Solomon with hard questions at Jerusalem, with a very great caravan, including camels that bore spices, gold in abundance, and precious stones.

item.title: 2 Kings 1
item.description: v1 Moab rebelled against Israel after the death of Ahab.

item.title: 2 Kings 2
item.description: v1 When Yahweh was about to take Elijah up by a whirlwind into heaven, Elijah went with Elisha from Gilgal.

item.title: 2 Kings 3
item.description: v1 Now Jehoram the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned twelve years.

item.title: 2 Kings 4
item.description: v1 Now a certain woman of the wives of the sons of the prophets cried out to Elisha, saying, “Your servant my husband is dead.

item.title: 2 Kings 5
item.description: v1 Now Naaman, captain of the army of the king of Syria, was a great man with his master, and honorable, because by him Yahweh had given victory to Syria: he was also a mighty man of valor, but he was a leper.

item.title: 2 Kings 6
item.description: v1 The sons of the prophets said to Elisha, “See now, the place where we live and meet with you is too small for us.

item.title: 2 Kings 7
item.description: v1 Elisha said, “Hear Yahweh’s word. Yahweh says, ‘Tomorrow about this time a seah of fine flour will be sold for a shekel, and two seahs of barley for a shekel, in the gate of Samaria.

item.title: 2 Kings 8
item.description: v1 Now Elisha had spoken to the woman whose son he had restored to life, saying, “Arise, and go, you and your household, and stay for a while wherever you can; for Yahweh has called for a famine.

item.title: 2 Kings 9
item.description: v1 Elisha the prophet called one of the sons of the prophets, and said to him, “Put your belt on your waist, take this vial of oil in your hand, and go to Ramoth Gilead.

item.title: 2 Samuel 1
item.description: v1 After the death of Saul, when David had returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had stayed two days in Ziklag;

item.title: 2 Samuel 2
item.description: v1 After this, David inquired of Yahweh, saying, “Shall I go up into any of the cities of Judah?

item.title: 2 Samuel 3
item.description: v1 Now there was long war between Saul’s house and David’s house.

item.title: 2 Samuel 4
item.description: v1 When Saul’s son heard that Abner was dead in Hebron, his hands became feeble, and all the Israelites were troubled.

item.title: 2 Samuel 5
item.description: v1 Then all the tribes of Israel came to David at Hebron, and spoke, saying, “Behold, we are your bone and your flesh.

item.title: 2 Samuel 6
item.description: v1 David again gathered together all the chosen men of Israel, thirty thousand.

item.title: 2 Samuel 7
item.description: v1 When the king lived in his house, and Yahweh had given him rest from all his enemies all around,

item.title: 2 Samuel 8
item.description: v1 After this, David struck the Philistines and subdued them; and David took the bridle of the mother city out of the hand of the Philistines.

item.title: 2 Samuel 9
item.description: v1 David said, “Is there yet any who is left of Saul’s house, that I may show him kindness for Jonathan’s sake?

item.title: Amos 1
item.description: v1 The words of Amos, who was among the herdsmen of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.

item.title: Amos 2
item.description: v1 Yahweh says: “For three transgressions of Moab, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; because he burned the bones of the king of Edom into lime;

item.title: Amos 3
item.description: v1 Hear this word that Yahweh has spoken against you, children of Israel, against the whole family which I brought up out of the land of Egypt, saying:

item.title: Amos 4
item.description: v1 Listen to this word, you cows of Bashan, who are on the mountain of Samaria, who oppress the poor, who crush the needy, who tell their husbands, “Bring us drinks!

item.title: Amos 5
item.description: v1 Listen to this word which I take up for a lamentation over you, O house of Israel.

item.title: Amos 6
item.description: v1 Woe to those who are at ease in Zion, and to those who are secure on the mountain of Samaria, the notable men of the chief of the nations, to whom the house of Israel come!

item.title: Amos 7
item.description: v1 Thus the Lord Yahweh showed me: and behold, he formed locusts in the beginning of the shooting up of the latter growth; and behold, it was the latter growth after the king’s harvest.

item.title: Amos 8
item.description: v1 Thus the Lord Yahweh showed me: behold, a basket of summer fruit.

item.title: Amos 9
item.description: v1 I saw the Lord standing beside the altar, and he said, “Strike the tops of the pillars, that the thresholds may shake; and break them in pieces on the head of all of them; and I will kill the last of them with the sword: there shall not one of them flee away, and there shall not one of them escape.

item.title: Daniel 1
item.description: v1 In the third year of the reign of Jehoiakim king of Judah, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came to Jerusalem and besieged it.

item.title: Daniel 2
item.description: v1 In the second year of the reign of Nebuchadnezzar, Nebuchadnezzar dreamed dreams; and his spirit was troubled, and his sleep went from him.

item.title: Daniel 3
item.description: v1 Nebuchadnezzar the king made an image of gold, whose height was sixty cubits, and its width six cubits.

item.title: Daniel 4
item.description: v1 Nebuchadnezzar the king, to all the peoples, nations, and languages, who dwell in all the earth: Peace be multiplied to you.

item.title: Daniel 5
item.description: v1 Belshazzar the king made a great feast to a thousand of his lords, and drank wine before the thousand.

item.title: Daniel 6
item.description: v1 It pleased Darius to set over the kingdom one hundred twenty local governors, who should be throughout the whole kingdom;

item.title: Daniel 7
item.description: v1 In the first year of Belshazzar king of Babylon, Daniel had a dream and visions of his head on his bed.

item.title: Daniel 8
item.description: v1 In the third year of the reign of king Belshazzar, a vision appeared to me, even to me, Daniel, after that which appeared to me at the first.

item.title: Daniel 9
item.description: v1 In the first year of Darius the son of Ahasuerus, of the offspring of the Medes, who was made king over the realm of the Chaldeans,

item.title: Deuteronomy 1
item.description: v1 These are the words which Moses spoke to all Israel beyond the Jordan in the wilderness, in the Arabah opposite Suf, between Paran, Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab.

item.title: Deuteronomy 2
item.description: v1 Then we turned, and took our journey into the wilderness by the way to the Red Sea, as Yahweh spoke to me; and we encircled Mount Seir many days.

item.title: Deuteronomy 3
item.description: v1 Then we turned, and went up the way to Bashan.

item.title: Deuteronomy 4
item.description: v1 Now, Israel, listen to the statutes and to the ordinances which I teach you, to do them; that you may live, and go in and possess the land which Yahweh, the God of your fathers, gives you.

item.title: Deuteronomy 5
item.description: v1 Moses called to all Israel, and said to them, “Hear, Israel, the statutes and the ordinances which I speak in your ears today, that you may learn them, and observe to do them.

item.title: Deuteronomy 6
item.description: v1 Now these are the commandments, the statutes, and the ordinances, which Yahweh your God commanded to teach you, that you might do them in the land that you go over to possess;

item.title: Deuteronomy 7
item.description: v1 When Yahweh your God brings you into the land where you go to possess it, and casts out many nations before you–the Hittite, the Girgashite, the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite–seven nations greater and mightier than you;

item.title: Deuteronomy 8
item.description: v1 You shall observe to do all the commandments which I command you today, that you may live, and multiply, and go in and possess the land which Yahweh swore to your fathers.

item.title: Deuteronomy 9
item.description: v1 Hear, Israel! You are to pass over the Jordan today, to go in to dispossess nations greater and mightier than yourself, cities great and fortified up to the sky,

item.title: Ecclesiastes 1
item.description: v1 The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem:

item.title: Ecclesiastes 2
item.description: v1 I said in my heart, “Come now, I will test you with mirth: therefore enjoy pleasure;” and behold, this also was vanity.

item.title: Ecclesiastes 3
item.description: v1 For everything there is a season, and a time for every purpose under heaven:

item.title: Ecclesiastes 4
item.description: v1 Then I returned and saw all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and behold, the tears of those who were oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.

item.title: Ecclesiastes 5
item.description: v1 Guard your steps when you go to God’s house; for to draw near to listen is better than to give the sacrifice of fools, for they don’t know that they do evil.

item.title: Ecclesiastes 6
item.description: v1 There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, and it is heavy on men:

item.title: Ecclesiastes 7
item.description: v1 A good name is better than fine perfume; and the day of death better than the day of one’s birth.

item.title: Ecclesiastes 8
item.description: v1 Who is like the wise man? And who knows the interpretation of a thing?

item.title: Ecclesiastes 9
item.description: v1 For all this I laid to my heart, even to explore all this: that the righteous, and the wise, and their works, are in the hand of God; whether it is love or hatred, man doesn’t know it; all is before them.

item.title: Epistle of Polycarp to the Philippians
item.description: Listen to the Audio Version Greeting Polycarp, and the presbyters with him, to the Church of God sojourning at Philippi: Mercy to you, and peace from God Almighty, and from the Lord Jesus Christ, our Saviour, be multiplied.

item.title: Esther 1
item.description: v1 Now in the days of Ahasuerus (this is Ahasuerus who reigned from India even to Ethiopia, over one hundred twenty-seven provinces),

item.title: Esther 2
item.description: v1 After these things, when the wrath of King Ahasuerus was pacified, he remembered Vashti, and what she had done, and what was decreed against her.

item.title: Esther 3
item.description: v1 After these things King Ahasuerus promoted Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, and advanced him, and set his seat above all the princes who were with him.

item.title: Esther 4
item.description: v1 Now when Mordecai found out all that was done, Mordecai tore his clothes, and put on sackcloth with ashes, and went out into the middle of the city, and wailed loudly and bitterly.

item.title: Esther 5
item.description: v1 Now on the third day, Esther put on her royal clothing, and stood in the inner court of the king’s house, next to the king’s house.

item.title: Esther 6
item.description: v1 On that night, the king couldn’t sleep. He commanded the book of records of the chronicles to be brought, and they were read to the king.

item.title: Esther 7
item.description: v1 So the king and Haman came to banquet with Esther the queen.

item.title: Esther 8
item.description: v1 On that day, King Ahasuerus gave the house of Haman, the Jews’ enemy, to Esther the queen.

item.title: Esther 9
item.description: v1 Now in the twelfth month, which is the month Adar, on the thirteenth day of the month, when the king’s commandment and his decree came near to be put in execution, on the day that the enemies of the Jews hoped to conquer them, (but it was turned out the opposite happened, that the Jews conquered those who hated them),

item.title: Exodus 1
item.description: v1 Now these are the names of the sons of Israel, who came into Egypt (every man and his household came with Jacob):

item.title: Exodus 2
item.description: v1 A man of the house of Levi went and took a daughter of Levi as his wife.

item.title: Exodus 3
item.description: v1 Now Moses was keeping the flock of Jethro, his father-in-law, the priest of Midian, and he led the flock to the back of the wilderness, and came to God’s mountain, to Horeb.

item.title: Exodus 4
item.description: v1 Moses answered, “But, behold, they will not believe me, nor listen to my voice; for they will say, ‘Yahweh has not appeared to you.

item.title: Exodus 5
item.description: v1 Afterward Moses and Aaron came, and said to Pharaoh, “This is what Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, ‘Let my people go, that they may hold a feast to me in the wilderness.

item.title: Exodus 6
item.description: v1 Yahweh said to Moses, “Now you shall see what I will do to Pharaoh, for by a strong hand he shall let them go, and by a strong hand he shall drive them out of his land.

item.title: Exodus 7
item.description: v1 Yahweh said to Moses, “Behold, I have made you as God to Pharaoh; and Aaron your brother shall be your prophet.

item.title: Exodus 8
item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, “Go in to Pharaoh, and tell him, ‘This is what Yahweh says, “Let my people go, that they may serve me.

item.title: Exodus 9
item.description: v1 Then Yahweh said to Moses, “Go in to Pharaoh, and tell him, ‘This is what Yahweh, the God of the Hebrews, says: “Let my people go, that they may serve me.

item.title: Ezekiel 1
item.description: v1 Now in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month, in the fifth day of the month, as I was among the captives by the river Chebar, the heavens were opened, and I saw visions of God.

item.title: Ezekiel 2
item.description: v1 He said to me, “Son of man, stand on your feet, and I will speak with you.

item.title: Ezekiel 3
item.description: v1 He said to me, “Son of man, eat what you find.

item.title: Ezekiel 4
item.description: v1 “You also, son of man, take a tile, and lay it before yourself, and portray on it a city, even Jerusalem.

item.title: Ezekiel 5
item.description: v1 “You, son of man, take a sharp sword. You shall take it as a barber’s razor to yourself, and shall cause it to pass over your head and over your beard.

item.title: Ezekiel 6
item.description: v1 Yahweh’s word came to me, saying, v2 “Son of man, set your face toward the mountains of Israel, and prophesy to them,

item.title: Ezekiel 7
item.description: v1 Moreover Yahweh’s word came to me, saying, v2 “You, son of man, the Lord Yahweh says to the land of Israel, ‘An end!

item.title: Ezekiel 8
item.description: v1 In the sixth year, in the sixth month, in the fifth day of the month, as I sat in my house, and the elders of Judah sat before me, the Lord Yahweh’s hand fell on me there.

item.title: Ezekiel 9
item.description: v1 Then he cried in my ears with a loud voice, saying, “Cause those who are in charge of the city to draw near, each man with his destroying weapon in his hand.

item.title: Ezra 1
item.description: v1 Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that Yahweh’s word by Jeremiah’s mouth might be accomplished, Yahweh stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,

item.title: Ezra 2
item.description: v1 Now these are the children of the province, who went up out of the captivity of those who had been carried away, whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried away to Babylon, and who returned to Jerusalem and Judah, everyone to his city;

item.title: Ezra 3
item.description: v1 When the seventh month had come, and the children of Israel were in the cities, the people gathered themselves together as one man to Jerusalem.

item.title: Ezra 4
item.description: v1 Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the children of the captivity were building a temple to Yahweh, the God of Israel;

item.title: Ezra 5
item.description: v1 Now the prophets, Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied to the Jews who were in Judah and Jerusalem.

item.title: Ezra 6
item.description: v1 Then Darius the king made a decree, and the house of the archives, where the treasures were laid up in Babylon, was searched.

item.title: Ezra 7
item.description: v1 Now after these things, in the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra the son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,

item.title: Ezra 8
item.description: v1 Now these are the heads of their fathers’ households, and this is the genealogy of those who went up with me from Babylon, in the reign of Artaxerxes the king:

item.title: Ezra 9
item.description: v1 Now when these things were done, the princes came near to me, saying, “The people of Israel, the priests, and the Levites, have not separated themselves from the peoples of the lands, following their abominations, even those of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, the Ammonites, the Moabites, the Egyptians, and the Amorites.

item.title: Genesis 1
item.description: v1 In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.

item.title: Genesis 2
item.description: v1 The heavens, the earth, and all their vast array were finished.

item.title: Genesis 3
item.description: v1 Now the serpent was more subtle than any animal of the field which Yahweh God had made.

item.title: Genesis 4
item.description: v1 The man knew Eve his wife. She conceived, and gave birth to Cain, and said, “I have gotten a man with Yahweh’s help.

item.title: Genesis 5
item.description: v1 This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, he made him in God’s likeness.

item.title: Genesis 6
item.description: v1 When men began to multiply on the surface of the ground, and daughters were born to them,

item.title: Genesis 7
item.description: v1 Yahweh said to Noah, “Come with all of your household into the ship, for I have seen your righteousness before me in this generation.

item.title: Genesis 8
item.description: v1 God remembered Noah, all the animals, and all the livestock that were with him in the ship; and God made a wind to pass over the earth.

item.title: Genesis 9
item.description: v1 God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, “Be fruitful, multiply, and replenish the earth.

item.title: Habakkuk 1
item.description: v1 The revelation which Habakkuk the prophet saw. v2 Yahweh, how long will I cry, and you will not hear?

item.title: Habakkuk 2
item.description: v1 I will stand at my watch, and set myself on the ramparts, and will look out to see what he will say to me, and what I will answer concerning my complaint.

item.title: Habakkuk 3
item.description: v1 A prayer of Habakkuk, the prophet, set to victorious music.

item.title: Haggai 1
item.description: v1 In the second year of Darius the king, in the sixth month, in the first day of the month, Yahweh’s word came by Haggai, the prophet, to Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, governor of Judah, and to Joshua, the son of Jehozadak, the high priest, saying,

item.title: Haggai 2
item.description: v1 In the seventh month, in the twenty-first day of the month, Yahweh’s word came by Haggai the prophet, saying,

item.title: Hosea 1
item.description: v1 Yahweh’s word that came to Hosea the son of Beeri, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel.

item.title: Hosea 2
item.description: v1 “Say to your brothers, ‘My people!’ and to your sisters, ‘My loved one!

item.title: Hosea 3
item.description: v1 Yahweh said to me, “Go again, love a woman loved by another, and an adulteress, even as Yahweh loves the children of Israel, though they turn to other gods, and love cakes of raisins.

item.title: Hosea 4
item.description: v1 Hear Yahweh’s word, you children of Israel; for Yahweh has a charge against the inhabitants of the land: “Indeed there is no truth, nor goodness, nor knowledge of God in the land.

item.title: Hosea 5
item.description: v1 “Listen to this, you priests! Listen, house of Israel, and give ear, house of the king!

item.title: Hosea 6
item.description: v1 “Come! Let’s return to Yahweh; for he has torn us to pieces, and he will heal us; he has injured us, and he will bind up our wounds.

item.title: Hosea 7
item.description: v1 When I would heal Israel, then the iniquity of Ephraim is uncovered, also the wickedness of Samaria; for they commit falsehood, and the thief enters in, and the gang of robbers ravages outside.

item.title: Hosea 8
item.description: v1 “Put the trumpet to your lips! Something like an eagle is over Yahweh’s house, because they have broken my covenant, and rebelled against my law.

item.title: Hosea 9
item.description: v1 Don’t rejoice, Israel, to jubilation like the nations; for you were unfaithful to your God.

item.title: Isaiah 1
item.description: v1 The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

item.title: Isaiah 2
item.description: v1 This is what Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.

item.title: Isaiah 3
item.description: v1 For, behold, the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, takes away from Jerusalem and from Judah supply and support, the whole supply of bread, and the whole supply of water;

item.title: Isaiah 4
item.description: v1 Seven women shall take hold of one man in that day, saying, “We will eat our own bread, and wear our own clothing.

item.title: Isaiah 5
item.description: v1 Let me sing for my well beloved a song of my beloved about his vineyard.

item.title: Isaiah 6

item.description: v1 In the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up to Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.

item.description: v1 Yahweh said to me, “Take a large tablet, and write on it with a man’s pen, ‘For Maher Shalal Hash Baz’;

item.title: Isaiah 9
item.description: v1 But there shall be no more gloom for her who was in anguish.

item.title: Jeremiah 1
item.description: v1 The words of Jeremiah the son of Hilkiah, one of the priests who were in Anathoth in the land of Benjamin.

item.description: v1 Yahweh’s word came to me, saying, v2 “Go and proclaim in the ears of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Yahweh says, “I remember for you the kindness of your youth, the love of your weddings; how you went after me in the wilderness, in a land that was not sown.

item.title: Jeremiah 3
item.description: v1 “They say, ‘If a man puts away his wife, and she goes from him, and becomes another man’s, should he return to her again?

item.title: Jeremiah 4
item.description: v1 “If you will return, Israel,” says Yahweh, “if you will return to me, and if you will put away your abominations out of my sight; then you will not be removed;

item.title: Jeremiah 5
item.description: v1 “Run back and forth through the streets of Jerusalem, and see now, and know, and seek in its wide places, if you can find a man, if there is anyone who does justly, who seeks truth, then I will pardon her.

item.title: Jeremiah 6
item.description: v1 “Flee for safety, you children of Benjamin, out of the middle of Jerusalem!

item.title: Jeremiah 7
item.description: v1 The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,

item.title: Jeremiah 8
item.description: v1 “At that time,” says Yahweh, “they will bring the bones of the kings of Judah, the bones of his princes, the bones of the priests, the bones of the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem, out of their graves.

item.title: Jeremiah 9
item.description: v1 Oh that my head were waters, and my eyes a spring of tears, that I might weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people!

item.title: Job 1
item.description: v1 There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job.

item.description: v1 Again, on the day when God’s sons came to present themselves before Yahweh, Satan came also among them to present himself before Yahweh.

item.description: v1 “Call now; is there any who will answer you? To which of the holy ones will you turn?

item.title: Job 6
item.description: v1 Then Job answered, v2 “Oh that my anguish were weighed, and all my calamity laid in the balances!

item.title: Job 7
item.description: v1 “Isn’t a man forced to labor on earth? Aren’t his days like the days of a hired hand?

item.title: Job 8
item.description: v1 Then Bildad the Shuhite answered, v2 “How long will you speak these things?

item.title: Job 9
item.description: v1 Then Job answered, v2 “Truly I know that it is so, but how can man be just with God?

item.title: Joel 1
item.description: v1 Yahweh’s word that came to Joel, the son of Pethuel.

item.title: Joel 2

item.title: Joel 3
item.description: v1 “For, behold, in those days, and in that time, when I restore the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem,

item.description: v1 Now Yahweh’s word came to Jonah the son of Amittai, saying,

item.description: v1 Then Jonah prayed to Yahweh, his God, out of the fish’s belly.

item.title: Jonah 3
item.description: v1 Yahweh’s word came to Jonah the second time, saying,

item.title: Jonah 4
item.description: v1 But it displeased Jonah exceedingly, and he was angry.

item.title: Joshua 1
item.description: v1 Now after the death of Moses the servant of Yahweh, Yahweh spoke to Joshua the son of Nun, Moses’ servant, saying,

item.description: v1 Joshua the son of Nun secretly sent two men out of Shittim as spies, saying, “Go, view the land, including Jericho.

item.title: Joshua 3
item.description: v1 Joshua got up early in the morning; and they moved from Shittim and came to the Jordan, he and all the children of Israel.

item.description: v1 When all the nation had completely crossed over the Jordan, Yahweh spoke to Joshua, saying,

item.description: v1 When all the kings of the Amorites, who were beyond the Jordan westward, and all the kings of the Canaanites, who were by the sea, heard how Yahweh had dried up the waters of the Jordan from before the children of Israel until we had crossed over, their heart melted, and there was no more spirit in them, because of the children of Israel.

item.title: Joshua 6
item.description: v1 Now Jericho was tightly shut up because of the children of Israel.

item.title: Joshua 7
item.description: v1 But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the devoted things; for Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took some of the devoted things.

item.title: Joshua 8
item.description: v1 Yahweh said to Joshua, “Don’t be afraid, and don’t be dismayed.

item.title: Joshua 9
item.description: v1 When all the kings who were beyond the Jordan, in the hill country, and in the lowland, and on all the shore of the great sea in front of Lebanon, the Hittite, the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite, heard of it

item.title: Judges 1
item.description: v1 After the death of Joshua, the children of Israel asked of Yahweh, saying, “Who should go up for us first against the Canaanites, to fight against them?

item.title: Judges 2
item.description: v1 Yahweh’s angel came up from Gilgal to Bochim. He said, “I brought you out of Egypt, and have brought you to the land which I swore to give your fathers.

item.description: v1 Now these are the nations which Yahweh left, to test Israel by them, even as many as had not known all the wars of Canaan;

item.description: v1 The children of Israel again did that which was evil in Yahweh’s sight, when Ehud was dead.

item.title: Judges 5
item.description: v1 Then Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam sang on that day, saying,

item.title: Judges 6
item.description: v1 The children of Israel did that which was evil in Yahweh’s sight, so Yahweh delivered them into the hand of Midian seven years.

item.title: Judges 7
item.description: v1 Then Jerubbaal, who is Gideon, and all the people who were with him, rose up early and encamped beside the spring of Harod.

item.title: Judges 8
item.description: v1 The men of Ephraim said to him, “Why have you treated us this way, that you didn’t call us when you went to fight with Midian?

item.description: v1 Abimelech the son of Jerubbaal went to Shechem to his mother’s brothers, and spoke with them and with all the family of the house of his mother’s father, saying,

item.description: v1 How the city sits solitary, that was full of people!

item.title: Lamentations 2
item.description: v1 How has the Lord covered the daughter of Zion with a cloud in his anger!

item.title: Lamentations 3
item.description: v1 I am the man who has seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

item.title: Lamentations 4
item.description: v1 How the gold has become dim! The most pure gold has changed!

item.title: Lamentations 5
item.description: v1 Remember, Yahweh, what has come on us. Look, and see our reproach.

item.description: v1 “‘If his offering is a sacrifice of peace offerings, if he offers it from the herd, whether male or female, he shall offer it without defect before Yahweh.

item.title: Leviticus 4

item.description: v1 “‘If anyone sins, in that he hears a public adjuration to testify, he being a witness, whether he has seen or known, if he doesn’t report it, then he shall bear his iniquity.

item.title: Leviticus 6
item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “If anyone sins, and commits a trespass against Yahweh, and deals falsely with his neighbor in a matter of deposit, or of bargain, or of robbery, or has oppressed his neighbor,

item.description: v1 “‘This is the law of the trespass offering: It is most holy.

item.title: Leviticus 8
item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Take Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments, and the anointing oil, and the bull of the sin offering, and the two rams, and the basket of unleavened bread;

item.description: v1 On the eighth day, Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel;

item.title: Malachi 1
item.description: v1 A revelation, Yahweh’s word to Israel by Malachi. v2 “I have loved you,” says Yahweh.

item.title: Malachi 2
item.description: v1 “Now, you priests, this commandment is for you. v2 If you will not listen, and if you will not take it to heart, to give glory to my name,” says Yahweh of Armies, “then I will send the curse on you, and I will curse your blessings.

item.title: Malachi 3
item.description: v1 “Behold, I send my messenger, and he will prepare the way before me; and the Lord, whom you seek, will suddenly come to his temple; and the messenger of the covenant, whom you desire, behold, he comes!

item.title: Malachi 4
item.description: v1 “For, behold, the day comes, it burns as a furnace; and all the proud, and all who work wickedness, will be stubble; and the day that comes will burn them up,” says Yahweh of Armies, “that it shall leave them neither root nor branch.

item.description: v1 Yahweh’s word that came to Micah the Morashtite in the days of Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah, which he saw concerning Samaria and Jerusalem.

item.description: v1 Woe to those who devise iniquity and work evil on their beds!

item.title: Micah 3
item.description: v1 I said, “Please listen, you heads of Jacob, and rulers of the house of Israel: Isn’t it for you to know justice?

item.description: v1 But in the latter days, it will happen that the mountain of Yahweh’s temple will be established on the top of the mountains, and it will be exalted above the hills; and peoples will stream to it.

item.description: v1 Now you shall gather yourself in troops, daughter of troops.

item.title: Micah 6
item.description: v1 Listen now to what Yahweh says: “Arise, plead your case before the mountains, and let the hills hear what you have to say.

item.title: Micah 7
item.description: v1 Misery is mine! Indeed, I am like one who gathers the summer fruits, as gleanings of the vineyard: There is no cluster of grapes to eat.

item.title: Nahum 3
item.description: v1 Woe to the bloody city! It is all full of lies and robbery.

item.description: v1 Then Eliashib the high priest rose up with his brothers the priests, and they built the sheep gate.

item.title: Nehemiah 5
item.description: v1 Then there arose a great cry of the people and of their wives against their brothers the Jews.

item.title: Nehemiah 6
item.description: v1 Now when it was reported to Sanballat, Tobiah, and to Geshem the Arabian, and to the rest of our enemies, that I had built the wall, and that there was no breach left in it (though even to that time I had not set up the doors in the gates)

item.description: v1 Now when the wall was built, and I had set up the doors, and the gatekeepers and the singers and the Levites were appointed,

item.description: v1 Now in the twenty-fourth day of this month the children of Israel were assembled with fasting, with sackcloth, and dirt on them.

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them: ‘When either man or woman shall make a special vow, the vow of a Nazirite, to separate himself to Yahweh,

item.description: v1 On the day that Moses had finished setting up the tabernacle, and had anointed it and sanctified it with all its furniture, and the altar with all its vessels, and had anointed and sanctified them;

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Speak to Aaron, and tell him, ‘When you light the lamps, the seven lamps shall give light in front of the lamp stand.

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,

item.title: Obadiah 1
item.description: v1 The vision of Obadiah. This is what the Lord Yahweh says about Edom.

item.title: Proverbs 1
item.description: v1 The proverbs of Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel:

item.title: Proverbs 2
item.description: v1 My son, if you will receive my words, and store up my commandments within you,

item.title: Proverbs 3
item.description: v1 My son, don’t forget my teaching; but let your heart keep my commandments:

item.title: Proverbs 4
item.description: v1 Listen, sons, to a father’s instruction. Pay attention and know understanding;

item.title: Proverbs 5
item.description: v1 My son, pay attention to my wisdom. Turn your ear to my understanding,

item.title: Proverbs 6
item.description: v1 My son, if you have become collateral for your neighbor, if you have struck your hands in pledge for a stranger,

item.title: Proverbs 7
item.description: v1 My son, keep my words. Lay up my commandments within you.

item.title: Proverbs 8
item.description: v1 Doesn’t wisdom cry out? Doesn’t understanding raise her voice?

item.title: Proverbs 9
item.description: v1 Wisdom has built her house. She has carved out her seven pillars.

item.title: Psalm 1
item.description: v1 Blessed is the man who doesn’t walk in the counsel of the wicked, nor stand on the path of sinners, nor sit in the seat of scoffers;

item.title: Psalm 2
item.description: v1 Why do the nations rage, and the peoples plot a vain thing?

item.title: Psalm 3
item.description: v1 Yahweh, how my adversaries have increased! Many are those who rise up against me.

item.title: Psalm 4
item.description: v1 Answer me when I call, God of my righteousness. Give me relief from my distress.

item.title: Psalm 5
item.description: v1 Give ear to my words, Yahweh. Consider my meditation.

item.title: Psalm 6
item.description: v1 Yahweh, don’t rebuke me in your anger, neither discipline me in your wrath.

item.title: Psalm 7
item.description: v1 Yahweh, my God, I take refuge in you. Save me from all those who pursue me, and deliver me,

item.title: Psalm 8
item.description: v1 Yahweh, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth!

item.title: Psalm 9
item.description: v1 I will give thanks to Yahweh with my whole heart.

item.title: Ruth 1
item.description: v1 In the days when the judges judged, there was a famine in the land.

item.title: Ruth 2
item.description: v1 Naomi had a relative of her husband’s, a mighty man of wealth, of the family of Elimelech, and his name was Boaz.

item.title: Ruth 3
item.description: v1 Naomi her mother-in-law said to her, “My daughter, shall I not seek rest for you, that it may be well with you?

item.title: Ruth 4
item.description: v1 Now Boaz went up to the gate and sat down there.

item.title: Song of Solomon 1
item.description: v1 The Song of songs, which is Solomon’s. v2 Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth; for your love is better than wine.

item.title: Song of Solomon 2
item.description: v1 I am a rose of Sharon, a lily of the valleys.

item.title: Song of Solomon 3
item.description: v1 By night on my bed, I sought him whom my soul loves.

item.title: Song of Solomon 4
item.description: v1 Behold, you are beautiful, my love. Behold, you are beautiful.

item.title: Song of Solomon 5
item.description: v1 I have come into my garden, my sister, my bride.

item.title: Song of Solomon 6
item.description: v1 Where has your beloved gone, you fairest among women? Where has your beloved turned, that we may seek him with you?

item.title: Song of Solomon 7
item.description: v1 How beautiful are your feet in sandals, prince’s daughter! Your rounded thighs are like jewels, the work of the hands of a skillful workman.

item.title: Song of Solomon 8
item.description: v1 Oh that you were like my brother, who nursed from the breasts of my mother!

item.title: The Epistle of Ignatius of Antioch to the Ephesians
item.description: Listen to the Audio Version Librevox: Lightfoot & Harmer, 1891 translation

item.title: Zechariah 1
item.description: v1 In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, Yahweh’s word came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying,

item.title: Zechariah 2
item.description: v1 I lifted up my eyes, and saw, and behold, a man with a measuring line in his hand.

item.title: Zechariah 3
item.description: v1 He showed me Joshua the high priest standing before Yahweh’s angel, and Satan standing at his right hand to be his adversary.

item.title: Zechariah 4
item.description: v1 The angel who talked with me came again, and wakened me, as a man who is wakened out of his sleep.

item.title: Zechariah 5
item.description: v1 Then again I lifted up my eyes, and saw, and behold, a flying scroll.

item.title: Zechariah 6
item.description: v1 Again I lifted up my eyes, and saw, and behold, four chariots came out from between two mountains; and the mountains were mountains of bronze.

item.title: Zechariah 7
item.description: v1 In the fourth year of king Darius, Yahweh’s word came to Zechariah in the fourth day of the ninth month, the month of Chislev.

item.title: Zechariah 8
item.description: v1 The word of Yahweh of Armies came to me.

item.title: Zechariah 9
item.description: v1 A revelation. Yahweh’s word is against the land of Hadrach, and will rest upon Damascus; for the eye of man and of all the tribes of Israel is toward Yahweh;

item.title: Zephaniah 1
item.description: v1 Yahweh’s word which came to Zephaniah, the son of Cushi, the son of Gedaliah, the son of Amariah, the son of Hezekiah, in the days of Josiah, the son of Amon, king of Judah.

item.title: Zephaniah 2
item.description: v1 Gather yourselves together, yes, gather together, you nation that has no shame,

item.title: Zephaniah 3
item.description: v1 Woe to her who is rebellious and polluted, the oppressing city!

item.title: 1 Chronicles 10
item.description: v1 Now the Philistines fought against Israel, and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain on Mount Gilboa.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 11
item.description: v1 Then all Israel gathered themselves to David to Hebron, saying, “Behold, we are your bone and your flesh.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 12
item.description: v1 Now these are those who came to David to Ziklag, while he was a fugitive from Saul the son of Kish.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 13
item.description: v1 David consulted with the captains of thousands and of hundreds, even with every leader.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 14
item.description: v1 Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David with cedar trees, masons, and carpenters, to build him a house.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 15
item.description: v1 David made himself houses in David’s city; and he prepared a place for God’s ark, and pitched a tent for it.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 16
item.description: v1 They brought in God’s ark, and set it in the middle of the tent that David had pitched for it; and they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 17
item.description: v1 When David lived in his house, David said to Nathan the prophet, “Behold, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of Yahweh’s covenant is in a tent.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 18
item.description: v1 After this, David defeated the Philistines and subdued them, and took Gath and its towns out of the hand of the Philistines.

item.title: 1 Chronicles 19
item.description: v1 After this, Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his place.

item.title: 1 Kings 10
item.description: v1 When the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon concerning Yahweh’s name, she came to test him with hard questions.

item.title: 1 Kings 11
item.description: v1 Now king Solomon loved many foreign women, together with the daughter of Pharaoh, women of the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Sidonians, and Hittites;

item.title: 1 Kings 12
item.description: v1 Rehoboam went to Shechem, for all Israel had come to Shechem to make him king.

item.title: 1 Kings 13
item.description: v1 Behold, a man of God came out of Judah by Yahweh’s word to Bethel; and Jeroboam was standing by the altar to burn incense.

item.title: 1 Kings 14
item.description: v1 At that time Abijah the son of Jeroboam became sick.

item.title: 1 Kings 15
item.description: v1 Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam the son of Nebat, Abijam began to reign over Judah.

item.title: 1 Kings 16
item.description: v1 Yahweh’s word came to Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha, saying,

item.title: 1 Kings 17
item.description: v1 Elijah the Tishbite, who was one of the settlers of Gilead, said to Ahab, “As Yahweh, the God of Israel, lives, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew nor rain these years, but according to my word.

item.title: 1 Kings 18
item.description: v1 After many days, Yahweh’s word came to Elijah, in the third year, saying, “Go, show yourself to Ahab; and I will send rain on the earth.

item.title: 1 Kings 19
item.description: v1 Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, and how he had killed all the prophets with the sword.

item.title: 1 Samuel 10
item.description: v1 Then Samuel took the vial of oil and poured it on his head, then kissed him and said, “Hasn’t Yahweh anointed you to be prince over his inheritance?

item.title: 1 Samuel 11
item.description: v1 Then Nahash the Ammonite came up and encamped against Jabesh Gilead; and all the men of Jabesh said to Nahash, “Make a covenant with us, and we will serve you.

item.description: v1 Samuel said to all Israel, “Behold, I have listened to your voice in all that you said to me, and have made a king over you.

item.title: 1 Samuel 13
item.description: v1 Saul was thirty years old when he became king, and he reigned over Israel forty-two years.

item.title: 1 Samuel 14
item.description: v1 Now it happened on a day that Jonathan the son of Saul said to the young man who bore his armor, “Come!

item.title: 1 Samuel 15
item.description: v1 Samuel said to Saul, “Yahweh sent me to anoint you to be king over his people, over Israel.

item.title: 1 Samuel 16
item.description: v1 Yahweh said to Samuel, “How long will you mourn for Saul, since I have rejected him from being king over Israel?

item.title: 1 Samuel 17
item.description: v1 Now the Philistines gathered together their armies to battle; and they were gathered together at Socoh, which belongs to Judah, and encamped between Socoh and Azekah in Ephesdammim.

item.title: 1 Samuel 18
item.description: v1 When he had finished speaking to Saul, the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul.

item.title: 1 Samuel 19
item.description: v1 Saul spoke to Jonathan his son, and to all his servants, that they should kill David.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 10
item.description: v1 Rehoboam went to Shechem; for all Israel had come to Shechem to make him king.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 11
item.description: v1 When Rehoboam had come to Jerusalem, he assembled the house of Judah and Benjamin, one hundred eighty thousand chosen men who were warriors, to fight against Israel, to bring the kingdom again to Rehoboam.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 12
item.description: v1 When the kingdom of Rehoboam was established and he was strong, he abandoned Yahweh’s law, and all Israel with him.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 13
item.description: v1 In the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam, Abijah began to reign over Judah.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 14
item.description: v1 So Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in David’s city; and Asa his son reigned in his place.

item.title: 2 Chronicles 15
item.description: v1 The Spirit of God came on Azariah the son of Oded:

item.title: 2 Chronicles 16

item.description: v1 At that time Yahweh said to me, “Cut two stone tablets like the first, and come up to me onto the mountain, and make an ark of wood.

item.description: v1 Therefore you shall love Yahweh your God, and keep his instructions, his statutes, his ordinances, and his commandments, always.

item.title: Deuteronomy 12
item.description: v1 These are the statutes and the ordinances which you shall observe to do in the land which Yahweh, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess all the days that you live on the earth.

item.description: v1 At the end of every seven years, you shall cancel debts.

item.title: Deuteronomy 16

item.description: v1 You shall not sacrifice to Yahweh your God an ox or a sheep in which is a defect or anything evil; for that is an abomination to Yahweh your God.

item.description: v1 The priests and the Levites–all the tribe of Levi–shall have no portion nor inheritance with Israel.

item.title: Deuteronomy 19
item.description: v1 When Yahweh your God cuts off the nations whose land Yahweh your God gives you, and you succeed them and dwell in their cities and in their houses,

item.description: v1 Dead flies cause the oil of the perfumer to produce an evil odor; so does a little folly outweigh wisdom and honor.

item.title: Ecclesiastes 11
item.description: v1 Cast your bread on the waters; for you shall find it after many days.

item.title: Ecclesiastes 12
item.description: v1 Remember also your Creator in the days of your youth, before the evil days come, and the years draw near, when you will say, “I have no pleasure in them;”

item.description: v1 King Ahasuerus laid a tribute on the land, and on the islands of the sea.

item.description: v1 Then some of the elders of Israel came to me, and sat before me.

item.description: v1 “Moreover, take up a lamentation for the princes of Israel,

item.description: v1 Now while Ezra prayed and made confession, weeping and casting himself down before God’s house, there was gathered together to him out of Israel a very great assembly of men and women and children; for the people wept very bitterly.

item.description: v1 Then Job answered, v2 “How long will you torment me, and crush me with words?

item.description: v1 Now when Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem heard how Joshua had taken Ai, and had utterly destroyed it; as he had done to Jericho and her king, so he had done to Ai and her king; and how the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel, and were among them,

item.description: v1 When Jabin king of Hazor heard of it, he sent to Jobab king of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Achshaph,

item.description: v1 Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, each took his censer, and put fire in it, and laid incense on it, and offered strange fire before Yahweh, which he had not commanded them.

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying to them,

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘If a woman conceives, and bears a male child, then she shall be unclean seven days; as in the days of her monthly period she shall be unclean.

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying, v2 “When a man shall have a swelling in his body’s skin, or a scab, or a bright spot, and it becomes in the skin of his body the plague of leprosy, then he shall be brought to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons, the priests.

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “This shall be the law of the leper in the day of his cleansing: He shall be brought to the priest,

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying, v2 “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When any man has a discharge from his body, because of his discharge he is unclean.

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses after the death of the two sons of Aaron, when they came near before Yahweh, and died;

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Speak to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘This is the thing which Yahweh has commanded:

item.description: v1 Yahweh said to Moses, v2 “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘I am Yahweh your God.

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Speak to all the congregation of the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘You shall be holy; for I, Yahweh your God, am holy.

item.description: v1 Now those who sealed were: Nehemiah the governor, the son of Hacaliah, and Zedekiah,

item.title: Nehemiah 12
item.description: v1 Now these are the priests and the Levites who went up with Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel, and Jeshua: Seraiah, Jeremiah, Ezra,

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Make two trumpets of silver.

item.description: v1 The people were complaining in the ears of Yahweh. When Yahweh heard it, his anger burned; and Yahweh’s fire burned among them, and consumed some of the outskirts of the camp.

item.description: v1 Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman whom he had married; for he had married a Cushite woman.

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Send men, that they may spy out the land of Canaan, which I give to the children of Israel.

item.description: v1 All the congregation lifted up their voice, and cried; and the people wept that night.

item.title: Numbers 15
item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When you have come into the land of your habitations, which I give to you,

item.description: v1 Now Korah, the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, with Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, and On, the son of Peleth, sons of Reuben, took some men.

item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying, v2 “Speak to the children of Israel, and take rods from them, one for each fathers’ house, of all their princes according to their fathers’ houses, twelve rods.

item.description: v1 Yahweh said to Aaron, “You and your sons and your fathers’ house with you shall bear the iniquity of the sanctuary; and you and your sons with you shall bear the iniquity of your priesthood.

item.title: Numbers 19
item.description: v1 Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying, v2 “This is the statute of the law which Yahweh has commanded.

item.title: Proverbs 10
item.description: v1 The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son makes a glad father; but a foolish son brings grief to his mother.

item.title: Proverbs 11
item.description: v1 A false balance is an abomination to Yahweh, but accurate weights are his delight.

item.title: Proverbs 12
item.description: v1 Whoever loves correction loves knowledge, but he who hates reproof is stupid.

item.title: Proverbs 13
item.description: v1 A wise son listens to his father’s instruction, but a scoffer doesn’t listen to rebuke.

item.title: Proverbs 14
item.description: v1 Every wise woman builds her house, but the foolish one tears it down with her own hands.

item.title: Proverbs 15
item.description: v1 A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.

item.title: Proverbs 16
item.description: v1 The plans of the heart belong to man, but the answer of the tongue is from Yahweh.

item.title: Proverbs 17
item.description: v1 Better is a dry morsel with quietness, than a house full of feasting with strife.

item.title: Proverbs 18
item.description: v1 A man who isolates himself pursues selfishness, and defies all sound judgment.

item.title: Proverbs 19
item.description: v1 Better is the poor who walks in his integrity than he who is perverse in his lips and is a fool.

item.title: Psalm 10
item.description: v1 Why do you stand far off, Yahweh? Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?

item.title: Psalm 11
item.description: v1 In Yahweh, I take refuge. How can you say to my soul, “Flee as a bird to your mountain”?

item.title: Psalm 12
item.description: v1 Help, Yahweh; for the godly man ceases. For the faithful fail from among the children of men.

item.title: Psalm 13
item.description: v1 How long, Yahweh? Will you forget me forever? How long will you hide your face from me?

item.title: Psalm 14
item.description: v1 The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.

item.title: Psalm 15
item.description: v1 Yahweh, who shall dwell in your sanctuary? Who shall live on your holy hill?

item.title: Psalm 16
item.description: v1 Preserve me, God, for I take refuge in you.

item.title: Psalm 17
item.description: v1 Hear, Yahweh, my righteous plea. Give ear to my prayer that doesn’t go out of deceitful lips.

item.title: Psalm 18
item.description: v1 I love you, Yahweh, my strength. v2 Yahweh is my rock, my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my rock, in whom I take refuge; my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower.

item.title: Psalm 19
item.description: v1 The heavens declare the glory of God. The expanse shows his handiwork.

item.title: The Epistle of Ignatius to the Magnesians
item.description: Listen to the Audio Version 1. Greeting Ignatius, who is also called Theophorus, to the Church blessed in the grace of God the Father, in Jesus Christ our Saviour, in whom I salute the Church which is at Magnesia, near the Mæander, and wish it abundance of happiness in God the Father, and in Jesus Christ.

item.description: v1 These also are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

item.title: Proverbs 28
item.description: v1 The wicked flee when no one pursues; but the righteous are as bold as a lion.

item.title: Proverbs 29

item.title: The Epistle of Ignatius to the Trallians
item.description: Listen to the Audio Version 1. Greeting Ignatius, who is also called Theophorus, to the holy Church which is at Tralles, in Asia, beloved of God, the Father of Jesus Christ, elect, and worthy of God, possessing peace through the flesh, and blood, and passion of Jesus Christ, who is our hope, through our rising again to Him, which also I salute in its fullness, and in the apostolic character, and wish abundance of happiness.

item.description: v1 “Cry aloud! Don’t spare! Lift up your voice like a trumpet!

item.description: v1 Behold, Yahweh’s hand is not shortened, that it can’t save; nor his ear dull, that it can’t hear.

item.title: Jeremiah 50
item.description: v1 The word that Yahweh spoke concerning Babylon, concerning the land of the Chaldeans, by Jeremiah the prophet.

item.title: Jeremiah 51
item.description: v1 Yahweh says: “Behold, I will raise up against Babylon, and against those who dwell in Lebkamai, a destroying wind.

item.title: Jeremiah 52
item.description: v1 Zedekiah was twenty-one years old when he began to reign.

item.title: Psalm 50
item.description: v1 The Mighty One, God, Yahweh, speaks, and calls the earth from sunrise to sunset.

item.title: Psalm 51
item.description: v1 Have mercy on me, God, according to your loving kindness.

item.title: Psalm 52
item.description: v1 Why do you boast of mischief, mighty man? God’s loving kindness endures continually.

item.title: Psalm 53
item.description: v1 The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.

item.title: Psalm 54
item.description: v1 Save me, God, by your name. Vindicate me in your might.

item.title: Psalm 55
item.description: v1 Listen to my prayer, God. Don’t hide yourself from my supplication.

item.title: Psalm 56
item.description: v1 Be merciful to me, God, for man wants to swallow me up.

item.title: Psalm 57
item.description: v1 Be merciful to me, God, be merciful to me, for my soul takes refuge in you.

item.title: Psalm 58
item.description: v1 Do you indeed speak righteousness, silent ones? Do you judge blamelessly, you sons of men?

item.title: Psalm 59
item.description: v1 Deliver me from my enemies, my God. Set me on high from those who rise up against me.

item.title: Isaiah 60
item.description: v1 “Arise, shine; for your light has come, and Yahweh’s glory has risen on you.

item.title: Isaiah 61
item.description: v1 The Lord Yahweh’s Spirit is on me, because Yahweh has anointed me to preach good news to the humble.

item.title: Isaiah 62
item.description: v1 For Zion’s sake I will not hold my peace, and for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, until her righteousness shines out like the dawn, and her salvation like a burning lamp.

item.title: Isaiah 63
item.description: v1 Who is this who comes from Edom, with dyed garments from Bozrah?

item.title: Isaiah 64
item.description: v1 Oh that you would tear the heavens, that you would come down, that the mountains might quake at your presence.

item.title: Isaiah 65
item.description: v1 “I am inquired of by those who didn’t ask. I am found by those who didn’t seek me.

item.title: Isaiah 66
item.description: v1 Yahweh says, “Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool.

item.title: Psalm 60
item.description: v1 God, you have rejected us. You have broken us down.

item.title: Psalm 61
item.description: v1 Hear my cry, God. Listen to my prayer. v2 From the end of the earth, I will call to you when my heart is overwhelmed.

item.title: Psalm 62
item.description: v1 My soul rests in God alone. My salvation is from him.

item.title: Psalm 63
item.description: v1 God, you are my God. I will earnestly seek you.

item.title: Psalm 64
item.description: v1 Hear my voice, God, in my complaint. Preserve my life from fear of the enemy.

item.title: Psalm 65
item.description: v1 Praise waits for you, God, in Zion. Vows shall be performed to you.

item.title: Psalm 66
item.description: v1 Make a joyful shout to God, all the earth!

item.title: Psalm 67
item.description: v1 May God be merciful to us, bless us, and cause his face to shine on us.

item.title: Psalm 68
item.description: v1 Let God arise! Let his enemies be scattered! Let them who hate him also flee before him.

item.title: Psalm 69
item.description: v1 Save me, God, for the waters have come up to my neck!

item.title: Psalm 70
item.description: v1 Hurry, God, to deliver me. Come quickly to help me, Yahweh.

item.title: Psalm 71
item.description: v1 In you, Yahweh, I take refuge. Never let me be disappointed.

item.title: Psalm 72
item.description: v1 God, give the king your justice; your righteousness to the royal son.

item.title: Psalm 73
item.description: v1 Surely God is good to Israel, to those who are pure in heart.

item.title: Psalm 74
item.description: v1 God, why have you rejected us forever? Why does your anger smolder against the sheep of your pasture?

item.title: Psalm 75
item.description: v1 We give thanks to you, God. We give thanks, for your Name is near.

item.title: Psalm 76
item.description: v1 In Judah, God is known. His name is great in Israel.

item.title: Psalm 77
item.description: v1 My cry goes to God! Indeed, I cry to God for help, and for him to listen to me.

item.title: Psalm 78
item.description: v1 Hear my teaching, my people. Turn your ears to the words of my mouth.

item.title: Psalm 79
item.description: v1 God, the nations have come into your inheritance. They have defiled your holy temple.

item.title: Psalm 80
item.description: v1 Hear us, Shepherd of Israel, you who lead Joseph like a flock, you who sit above the cherubim, shine out.

item.title: Psalm 81
item.description: v1 Sing aloud to God, our strength! Make a joyful shout to the God of Jacob!

item.title: Psalm 82
item.description: v1 God presides in the great assembly. He judges among the gods.

item.title: Psalm 83
item.description: v1 God, don’t keep silent. Don’t keep silent, and don’t be still, God.

item.title: Psalm 84
item.description: v1 How lovely are your dwellings, Yahweh of Armies! v2 My soul longs, and even faints for the courts of Yahweh.

item.title: Psalm 85
item.description: v1 Yahweh, you have been favorable to your land. You have restored the fortunes of Jacob.

item.title: Psalm 86
item.description: v1 Hear, Yahweh, and answer me, for I am poor and needy.

item.title: Psalm 87
item.description: v1 His foundation is in the holy mountains. v2 Yahweh loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

item.title: Psalm 88
item.description: v1 Yahweh, the God of my salvation, I have cried day and night before you.

item.title: Psalm 89
item.description: v1 I will sing of the loving kindness of Yahweh forever.

item.title: Psalm 90
item.description: v1 Lord, you have been our dwelling place for all generations.

item.title: Psalm 91
item.description: v1 He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High will rest in the shadow of the Almighty.

item.title: Psalm 92
item.description: v1 It is a good thing to give thanks to Yahweh, to sing praises to your name, Most High,

item.title: Psalm 93
item.description: v1 Yahweh reigns! He is clothed with majesty! Yahweh is armed with strength.

item.title: Psalm 94
item.description: v1 Yahweh, you God to whom vengeance belongs, you God to whom vengeance belongs, shine out.

item.title: Psalm 95
item.description: v1 Oh come, let’s sing to Yahweh. Let’s shout aloud to the rock of our salvation!

item.title: Psalm 96
item.description: v1 Sing to Yahweh a new song! Sing to Yahweh, all the earth.

item.title: Psalm 97
item.description: v1 Yahweh reigns! Let the earth rejoice! Let the multitude of islands be glad!

item.title: Psalm 98
item.description: v1 Sing to Yahweh a new song, for he has done marvelous things!

item.title: Psalm 99
item.description: v1 Yahweh reigns! Let the peoples tremble. He sits enthroned among the cherubim.

item.title: Psalm 100
item.description: v1 Shout for joy to Yahweh, all you lands! v2 Serve Yahweh with gladness.

item.title: Psalm 101
item.description: v1 I will sing of loving kindness and justice. To you, Yahweh, I will sing praises.

item.title: Psalm 102
item.description: v1 Hear my prayer, Yahweh! Let my cry come to you.

item.title: Psalm 103
item.description: v1 Praise Yahweh, my soul! All that is within me, praise his holy name!

item.title: Psalm 104
item.description: v1 Bless Yahweh, my soul. Yahweh, my God, you are very great.

item.title: Psalm 105
item.description: v1 Give thanks to Yahweh! Call on his name! Make his doings known among the peoples.

item.title: Psalm 106
item.description: v1 Praise Yahweh! Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, for his loving kindness endures forever.

item.title: Psalm 107
item.description: v1 Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, for his loving kindness endures forever.

item.title: Psalm 108
item.description: v1 My heart is steadfast, God. I will sing and I will make music with my soul.

item.title: Psalm 109
item.description: v1 God of my praise, don’t remain silent, v2 for they have opened the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of deceit against me.

item.title: Psalm 110
item.description: v1 Yahweh says to my Lord, “Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies your footstool for your feet.

item.title: Psalm 111
item.description: v1 Praise Yah! I will give thanks to Yahweh with my whole heart, in the council of the upright, and in the congregation.

item.title: Psalm 112
item.description: v1 Praise Yah! Blessed is the man who fears Yahweh, who delights greatly in his commandments.

item.title: Psalm 113
item.description: v1 Praise Yah! Praise, you servants of Yahweh, praise Yahweh’s name.

item.title: Psalm 114
item.description: v1 When Israel went out of Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of foreign language,

item.title: Psalm 115
item.description: v1 Not to us, Yahweh, not to us, but to your name give glory, for your loving kindness, and for your truth’s sake.

item.title: Psalm 116
item.description: v1 I love Yahweh, because he listens to my voice, and my cries for mercy.

item.title: Psalm 117
item.description: v1 Praise Yahweh, all you nations! Extol him, all you peoples!

item.title: Psalm 118
item.description: v1 Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, for his loving kindness endures forever.

item.title: Psalm 119
item.description: v1 Blessed are those whose ways are blameless, who walk according to Yahweh’s law.

item.title: Psalm 120
item.description: v1 In my distress, I cried to Yahweh. He answered me.

item.title: Psalm 121
item.description: v1 I will lift up my eyes to the hills. Where does my help come from?

item.title: Psalm 122
item.description: v1 I was glad when they said to me, “Let’s go to Yahweh’s house!

item.title: Psalm 123
item.description: v1 I lift up my eyes to you, you who sit in the heavens.

item.title: Psalm 124
item.description: v1 If it had not been Yahweh who was on our side, let Israel now say,

item.title: Psalm 125
item.description: v1 Those who trust in Yahweh are as Mount Zion, which can’t be moved, but remains forever.

item.title: Psalm 126
item.description: v1 When Yahweh brought back those who returned to Zion, we were like those who dream.

item.title: Psalm 127
item.description: v1 Unless Yahweh builds the house, they who build it labor in vain.

item.title: Psalm 128
item.description: v1 Blessed is everyone who fears Yahweh, who walks in his ways.

item.title: Psalm 129
item.description: v1 Many times they have afflicted me from my youth up.

item.title: Psalm 130
item.description: v1 Out of the depths I have cried to you, Yahweh.

item.title: Psalm 131
item.description: v1 Yahweh, my heart isn’t arrogant, nor my eyes lofty; nor do I concern myself with great matters, or things too wonderful for me.

item.title: Psalm 132
item.description: v1 Yahweh, remember David and all his affliction, v2 how he swore to Yahweh, and vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:

item.title: Psalm 133
item.description: v1 See how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to live together in unity!

item.title: Psalm 134
item.description: v1 Look! Praise Yahweh, all you servants of Yahweh, who stand by night in Yahweh’s house!

item.title: Psalm 135
item.description: v1 Praise Yah! Praise Yahweh’s name! Praise him, you servants of Yahweh,

item.title: Psalm 136
item.description: v1 Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good; for his loving kindness endures forever.

item.title: Psalm 137
item.description: v1 By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down. Yes, we wept, when we remembered Zion.

item.title: Psalm 138
item.description: v1 I will give you thanks with my whole heart. Before the gods, I will sing praises to you.

item.title: Psalm 139
item.description: v1 Yahweh, you have searched me, and you know me.

item.title: Psalm 140
item.description: v1 Deliver me, Yahweh, from the evil man. Preserve me from the violent man:

item.title: Psalm 141
item.description: v1 Yahweh, I have called on you. Come to me quickly!

item.title: Psalm 142
item.description: v1 I cry with my voice to Yahweh. With my voice, I ask Yahweh for mercy.

item.title: Psalm 143
item.description: v1 Hear my prayer, Yahweh. Listen to my petitions. In your faithfulness and righteousness, relieve me.

item.title: Psalm 144
item.description: v1 Blessed be Yahweh, my rock, who teaches my hands to war, and my fingers to battle:

item.title: Psalm 145
item.description: v1 I will exalt you, my God, the King. I will praise your name forever and ever.

item.title: Psalm 146
item.description: v1 Praise Yah! Praise Yahweh, my soul. v2 While I live, I will praise Yahweh.

item.title: Psalm 147
item.description: v1 Praise Yah, for it is good to sing praises to our God; for it is pleasant and fitting to praise him.

item.title: Psalm 148
item.description: v1 Praise Yah! Praise Yahweh from the heavens! Praise him in the heights!

item.title: Psalm 149
item.description: v1 Praise Yahweh! Sing to Yahweh a new song, his praise in the assembly of the saints.

item.title: Psalm 150
item.description: v1 Praise Yah! Praise God in his sanctuary! Praise him in his heavens for his acts of power!

item.title: Letter to the Corinthians
item.description: Genesis 1 Listen to the Audio Version Chapter 1-10 Chapter 11-20 Chapter 21-30 Chapter 31-40 Chapter 41-50 Chapter 51-59 The Salutation & Praise of the Corinthians The church of God which sojourns at Rome, to the church of God sojourning at Corinth, to them that are called and sanctified by the will of God, through our Lord Jesus Christ: Grace unto you, and peace, from Almighty God through Jesus Christ, be multiplied.
